title: Breaking Down Big Tech Earnings
text: The market's contrasting reactions to Q1 results from four of the ‘Big 5 Tech Players' – Amazon AMZN, Alphabet GOOGL, Meta META & Microsoft MSFT – provides us a window into what market participants see as essential for these stocks to maintain their recent price momentum. Apple AAPL will report Q1 results on Thursday, May 4th.

title: Amazon delivery drivers ratify union contract, but benefits could be short-lived
text: Dozens of drivers who deliver packages for Amazon.com Inc. AMZN ratified a contract Friday that promises pay raises and safety protections, the Teamsters said. Among other things, the contract will bring wages for the Palmdale, Calif.

title: The Top 3 E-Commerce Stocks to Buy for Long-Term Success
text: The pandemic has had a tremendous impact on the world of retail. In the beginning, it caused consumers to shift buying habits rapidly toward digital means.

title: Should you buy Amazon stock after its Q1 earnings report?
text: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) is down nearly 4.0% on Friday after warning of continued deceleration in cloud revenue.

title: Microsoft's Activision bid ‘not dead;' Alphabet, Amazon price targets raised and other analyst calls of the week
text: Snap has earned a repeat ‘Perform' rating from Oppenheimer analysts after reporting first-quarter results that failed to impress investors, sending the stock tumbling by almost 20% on Friday.

title: Amazon is developing an improved LLM to power Alexa
text: Amazon is building a more “generalized and capable” large language model (LLM) to power Alexa, said Amazon CEO Andy Jassy during the company's first-quarter earnings call yesterday. An LLM, like ChatGPT, is a deep learning algorithm that can recognize, summarize and generate text and other content based on knowledge from enormous amounts of text data.

title: Amazon earns price target raise despite weaker cloud outlook
text: Analysts at Oppenheimer have raised their price target for Amazon noting that the ecommerce giant's improved gross profit more than offset its slightly lower revenue outlook for its cloud business Amazon Web Services (AWS). The analysts upped their price target to $130 from $125 and awarded the stock an ‘Outperform' rating.

title: Why Amazon Stock Dropped After Earnings
text: Amazon's share price jumped prior to the first-quarter earnings report, but it's giving back some of those gains Friday. Revenue from Amazon Web Services didn't grow sequentially from the fourth quarter.

title: Amazon Tax Subsidies Are Inefficient Job Creators
text: Government subsidies to companies have accomplished relatively little & are an inefficient way to create jobs. Counties and municipalities should instead pursue job growth by focusing on improving the business & social environment of their community rather than giving taxpayer money to corporations.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) Q1 Earnings & Sales Beat Estimates, Up Y/Y
text: Amazon's (AMZN) first-quarter results reflect strength in AWS, Prime, third-party sellers and advertising businesses.

title: Tech earnings calls show mega-cap companies going big on A.I. as they cut costs elsewhere
text: In their calls with analysts this week, Alphabet, Microsoft, Amazon and Meta emphasized their hefty investments in large language models.

title: Amazon Earnings: 5 Key Metrics Investors Should See
text: First-quarter revenue grew 9% year over year, beating Wall Street's expectation for 7% growth. The quarter's earnings per share were $0.31, easily exceeding the $0.21 analyst consensus estimate.

title: Why Are Cloud Stocks AMZN, CRWD, SNOW, TWLO Down Today?
text: Cloud stocks are falling on Friday and investors can look to Amazon's (NASDAQ: AMZN ) latest earnings report to understand why. The big news that has traders in cloud stocks worried is the company's cloud performance in Q1.

title: Amazon slips more than 4% over slowdown in cloud business
text: The Seattle-based goliath saw its stock price soar by as much as 12% in after-hours trading on Thursday, but those gains were erased.

title: Amazon.com Sinks After Issuing Gloomy Cloud Forecast
text: E-commerce giant Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) stepped into the earnings confessional after yesterday's close, reporting a first-quarter profit and revenue that beat analysts expectations.

title: Pinterest Inks Deal With Amazon Ads to Fuel Shoppable Content
text: In an effort to create more shoppable content, Pinterest has inked a multiyear deal with Amazon Ads to enhance the platform's offering of relevant products and brands, and notably marks Amazon's status as Pinterest's first third-party advertising partner.

title: Amazon Cuts Back on Free Returns While Walmart Gives Away Free Memberships
text: For Amazon and Walmart customers, convenience is key for each step — everything from ordering to paying to receiving a delivery order or picking up goods — and few things are more convenient than free services. Amazon Prime and Walmart+ offer members free deliveries, free video streaming, free returns and other perks.

title: Can Amazon Partnership Save Pinterest (PINS) Stock?
text: Pinterest (NYSE: PINS ) stock is tumbling 11% in early trading. However, the social media website reported stronger-than-expected first-quarter results and unveiled a new partnership with Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN ).

title: Amazon Reports, And It's Mostly Good
text: Amazon.com Inc. NASDAQ: AMZN shares have been rallying since January and are up 35% in that timeframe, with more than 10% added in the past fortnight alone. Coming from a multi-year low that had shares trading back at 2018 levels, it meant investors could start to relax just a little bit.

title: Amazon Stock Down 2% As High Prices Slow AWS Growth
text: AWS is slowing down as Azure speeds up. That could hurt Amazon's operating profit.

title: U.S. stocks open lower as Amazon's cloud outlook, sticky inflation disappoint investors
text: U.S. stock indexes opened lower on Friday after Amazon warned about a slowdown in its cloud business, while strong inflation data cemented expectations for higher rates in the U.S.. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 70 points, or 0.2%, to 33,758.

title: Cathie Wood Gets Crushed By An Investment That Costs 73% Less
text: Growth stocks in the S&P 500 are playing right into Cathie Wood's hands. But even the famed investor can't outperform a cheap index.

title: First Republic's stock rises on rescue talks, Amazon shares fall on cloud forecast and other stocks on the move
text: Here were some of the biggest stock movers on Friday:

title: Amazon's Cloud Outlook Panicked Investors. Don't Overreact, Analysts Say.
text: Amazon's mention of slowing revenue growth in its Amazon Web Services unit hit shares hard but analysts see reason to be positive.

title: Amazon Lays Off More People
text: Andy Jassy, CEO of Amazon is acting fast.

title: Morning Bid: Amazon cools, Intel warms, Japan hesitate
text: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan

title: Amazon catches a storm in the cloud, but ‘significant fear' may mean opportunity
text: Is Microsoft Corp. raining on Amazon.com Inc.'s parade in cloud computing?

title: Why Amazon, Disney, and Comcast Are No-Brainer Buys Right Now
text: Amazon shares fell almost 50% last year, but its dominant e-commerce and cloud businesses give it a promising outlook. Disney's recent cost-cutting measures could pay off big over the next year.

title: U.S. stock futures lower as investors weigh up Amazon cloud worries, Fed inflation gauge looms
text: U.S. stock futures pointed to a lower start for Friday, with technology in the lead after caution from Amazon.com Inc. on its cloud sector, while investors await an update on the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge.
